In 1975, Elizabeth Briggs Johnson joined the NRC’s Atomic and Safety and Licensing Board Panel and served until her retirement in 1996, making her the longest serving woman in ASLBP history. #WomensHistoryMonth

This #SocialMediaDay we say thanks for your follows, likes, shares and clicks. In our 11 years on Twitter, we've sent more than 5,000 tweets with useful info about our people and agency. Look for us on Facebook, LinkedIn, YouTube and Flickr too. https://t.co/1m3ki05K1D https://t.co/NREDWoyFvF

NRC Commissioner Jeff Baran recently toured the FitzPatrick Nuclear Power Plant including the control room. During his visit he discussed safety-related equipment performance with NRC resident inspectors and licensee staff. https://t.co/trnXJxfOqf

In honor of #NationalCameraDay we invite you to enjoy a video compilation of photos taken by some of our staff to demonstrate NRC’s organizational values from their unique perspectives. https://t.co/4yoTc4rUfr

A delegation from the NRC visited the French Embassy in D.C., to share their knowledge on agency policies and regulations on #AdvancedReactors, fuel facilities, and #SpentFuelStorage with members of France’s Commission Nationale d’Evaluation. https://t.co/9LOTytxUV5
#NRCNews: We’ve named a new resident inspector at the Clinton #nuclear power plant in Illinois. https://t.co/KGOCBzJjjL

For #NationalTakeYourDogtoWorkDay we’re focusing on NRC’s Trish Galallee and her service dog-in-training, Porthos. Though he’s not yet #OntheJob fulltime, he's  learning about the workplace and how to interact with co-workers. Watch Porthos at the NRC. https://t.co/ISC6cZ6suW

Our Executive Director for Operations Dan Dorman recently swapped his tie and jacket for some boots and a hardhat while #OntheJob at the Palo Verde #Nuclear Generating Station. He met with our resident inspectors and plant managers and visited an offsite national response center. https://t.co/nj37mQJoGy
#NRCNews: We’ve named a new senior resident inspector at the Surry #nuclear power plant in Virginia. https://t.co/i1UpLPtnix

#InternationalWomenInEngineeringDay is a great day to highlight the women of the #NRC, who serve in a variety of technical roles at our agency. They play a crucial role in carrying out our mission by bringing diverse and innovative thinking to the job every day. https://t.co/M4s0OE9XDi

NRC Chairman Hanson spoke about oversight of the current fleet, preparations to license new technologies, and other topics during a “Regulatory Priorities” discussion moderated by Dominion Energy’s Dan Stoddard during the Nuclear Energy Assembly in D.C., Tuesday. #NEA2022 https://t.co/AVY3l5xr6t
#NRCNews: We’ve selected a new resident inspector to serve at the Dresden #nuclear power plant in Illinois. https://t.co/nGYYkJqoLG
#NRCNews: We’ve made the supplemental environmental report for the Turkey Point subsequent license renewal publicly available. https://t.co/XKnLYMM1Og
#NRCNews: We’ve amended the licensing, inspection and annual fee rule for FY 2022. https://t.co/AxhnN1E9mQ
#NRCNews: We’re meeting with U.S. Air Force officials on June 30 to discuss apparent violations related to the use of #radioactive materials. https://t.co/KCK5nJDCCX
Have a safe Juneteenth holiday on June 20. https://t.co/fekl2bvunr

The #NRAN program is one way the we develop recently graduated engineers and scientists in a broad range of fields while fostering diverse and innovative thinking. The second cohort is starting soon. Learn more about the NRAN program at https://t.co/PgyUpoyuP1

Congrats to some employees with a special distinction -– the first cohort to complete our Nuclear Regulator Apprenticeship Network program. They successfully completed technical training courses, seminars and assignments, finished a group project and performed apprenticeships. https://t.co/7BbDGo6HVs
#NRCNews: We’ve proposed a penalty to Mistras Group, Inc., for apparent security-related violations concerning their licensed operations in Prudhoe Bay, Alaska. https://t.co/mo0IjzwmLA

In honor of the upcoming federal holiday, we flew the #Juneteenth flag at our headquarters complex and held an event in honor of the day. Those in attendance at the flag raising and the more than 200 at the virtual event reflect the agency’s dedication to diversity and inclusion. https://t.co/wObChp4q21
#NRCNews: We’re having an open house on June 23 to discuss 2021 #SafetyPerformance at the Point Beach nuclear power plant in Wisconsin. https://t.co/w1BGXDbOsH

#NRCNews: We’re having a meeting on June 22 to discuss 2021 #SafetyPerformance at the Davis-Besse #nuclear power plant. Attend the meeting in-person in Oak Harbor, Ohio, or join us virtually via webinar. https://t.co/Qh086LzRn5

We’re hosting a webinar on June 16 to explain our oversight of the Palisades #decommissioning process after Entergy certified to us on June 13 that it ceased operations and permanently removed fuel from the #reactor. Meeting details at https://t.co/zXcPooM7ip https://t.co/Imb32C57bz
#NRCNews: We’ve proposed a fine to Advanced Inspection Technologies, Inc., for apparent violations of our requirements.  https://t.co/zJ7kHWtOXB

#OntheJob, our inspectors Paul Zurawski, Robert Wehrmann and John Gewargis, set up at the Silver Beach Center in Southwestern Michigan, to talk about  #SafetyPerformance at the D.C. Cook #nuclear power plant sharing info about nuclear power plant concepts and our safety mission. https://t.co/Yjjj003F4F

Chairman Hanson visited our Technical Training Center in Tennessee. He met w/instructors and discussed the challenge of keeping inspectors qualified during the pandemic. He also got a look at how the analog and digital operating #reactor simulators are used to train NRC staff. https://t.co/T0PKMFEuWa

Tomorrow’s Commission Briefing on Human Capital and Equal Employment Opportunity will be virtual. You're welcome to watch the virtual briefing in person from the #NRC Commissioner’s Conference Room or view it live via webcast at https://t.co/QEGtWKIxvc
#NRCNews: We’ve launched a special inspection to review a failure of a diesel generator during testing at the #GrandGulf #nuclear power plant. https://t.co/GQnaAT8kQy
#NRCNews: We’ve named a new senior resident inspector at the Diablo Canyon #nuclear power plant in California. https://t.co/eMhdaa2JVZ

Our online Glossary ranges from ALARA, the acronym for “as low as (is) reasonably achievable” -- to Zirconium, the metal used in cladding for nuclear fuel rods. For NRC #eLearning, check out our glossary and see if you can learn anything new. https://t.co/79sM5fShFY https://t.co/6N6ous2bc5

NRC’s Chris Safouri and Brad Bishop were #OntheJob at the Vogtle plant during a refueling outage for an inspection on the licensee’s #reactor head stand modification. During the outage the licensee removes the reactor head and puts it on a stand to perform refueling activities. https://t.co/HT1XEDAMpr

Barbara Sanford temporarily traded her NRC position  for an opportunity with the White House Leadership Development Program. She and her #WHLDP colleagues recently paid us a virtual visit to hear from agency sr. leaders, including Commissioner David Wright. https://t.co/rQoZSdPLGw

#NRCNews: We’re conducting a pre-decisional enforcement conference with Testing Engineers & Consultants Inc. on June 13 to discuss apparent violations associated with the company’s radiation safety practices. https://t.co/NegmFpxbSc

In celebration of #PrideMonth – for the first time in NRC history – the Pride flag was raised in front of our headquarters complex for the day in recognition of the #LGBTQ+ community and in support of diversity and inclusion efforts at the agency. https://t.co/HC2cgo1T6Q

For decades, certain foods have been irradiated to kill pathogens such as Ecoli and prevent food-borne illnesses. Many foods are sanitized this way without harm to their flavor or nutritional value. Importantly, the food doesn't become #radioactive.

It's #WorldFoodSafetyDay, and you may not know it but we have a part to play in keeping what we eat safe. We and the Agreement States license irradiators using gamma radiation from a sealed #radioactive source such as cobalt-60 or cesium-137. https://t.co/DF67tQfTGv
#NRCNews: We’ve named a new resident inspector at the Grand Gulf #nuclear power plant in Mississippi. https://t.co/BvqdM0qzsr

Our inspectors Tim Steadham and Steve Roberts were #OntheJob at the Grand Gulf #nuclear power plant during a recent refueling and maintenance outage inspecting safety-related valves located in an area where there is #radioactive contamination. https://t.co/mOi9FyIT6k

Some of our staff recently briefed our Commission about ongoing efforts to transform how we do our job so that we can be the most flexible, effective regulators possible. You can watch the briefing at https://t.co/lbfTl7yM34. https://t.co/xBFsWW3A2i

#NRC Senior Resident Inspector Chris Highley was #OntheJob at the Susquehanna #nuclear power plant navigating tight quarters inside the protective structure that surrounds the #reactor for an inspection during a recent refueling and maintenance outage. https://t.co/9f6ab97876

We’ve produced another joint report with @CNSC_CCSN finding #AdvancedReactor vendor Terrestrial Energy is off to a good start in identifying “initiating events” that could challenge safety in the company’s molten salt-cooled design. https://t.co/f6ENLfRysS https://t.co/lEHw3qinWK

Emergency Response Coordinators, like our Region II's Shani Seaton, are #OnTheJob as #HurricaneSeason begins. They’re ready to expand communications with #nuclear plant personnel, monitor conditions from the incident response center and dispatch additional inspectors if needed. https://t.co/znuYloEoEv
